resources.title: Caniuse
resources.desc: 'Can I use' provides up-to-date browser support tables for support of front-end web technologies on desktop and mobile web browsers.

resources.title: DevDocs
resources.desc: DevDocs combines multiple API documentations in a fast, organized, and searchable interface. Online and offline, always have your docs with you.

resources.title: Rico's cheatsheets
resources.desc: Cheatsheets for any kind of technologies in the web domain.

resources.title: Developer Roadmap
resources.desc: Below you find a set of charts demonstrating the paths that you can take and the technologies that you would want to adopt in order to become a frontend, backend or a devops.

resources.title: Google Developer
resources.desc: Tutorials, guides, and best practices for building the next generation of web experiences.

resources.title: Google Chrome Youtube
resources.desc: Making the web more awesome - latest news about google chrome

resources.title: Code wars
resources.desc: Challenge yourself on kata, created by the community to strengthen different skills. Master your current language of choice, or expand your understanding of a new one.

resources.title: Exercism
resources.desc: Learn to code in a variety of languages. Complete programming challenges, view other's solutions, and get community feedback on your code.

resources.title: Learn X in Y min
resources.desc: Take a whirlwind tour of your next favorite language. Community-driven!

resources.title: CodeSignal
resources.desc: CodeSignal (formerly CodeFights) is an online programming tournament where you compete against real people in real time to try to finish the coding challenges first. You can play with random people, your friends, or they even have a single player arcade mode.
